decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby approved shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby approved shall either match those used in the existing building or shall be as specified in this application.

Condition : 3 - The development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted therewith (2775/A1/10, 2775/A1/11, 2775/A1/12, 2775/A1/13, 2775/A1/14, received 05 June 2014) and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 4 - No development shall take place, until details have been submitted to and approved by the planning authority, for a scheme of acoustic insulation and any associated ventilation, to ensure that the maximum noise levels permitted within the residential units with windows closed and any other necessary means of ventilation provided, shall not exceed the 'good' design limits given in BS8233:1999'.

Condition : 5 - The access doorway to the ground floor unit shall have a minimum clear width of 1.8m, a level surface or ramp between the pavement and the floor and a door handle of not more than 1m above ground level.

Condition : 6 - The use hereby permitted shall not be begun until details of the arrangements for storing of waste and recycled materials have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The arrangements for storing waste and recycled materials shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with any approval given and shall be completed before any part of the accommodation hereby permitted is occupied.

Condition : 7 - No development shall take place until details have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, for a scheme of reducing carbon emissions from the total energy needs (heat, cooling and power) of the development by at least 20%, from the on-site renewable energy generation unless it can be demonstrated that such provision is not feasible. The details shall be carried out as approved.
description: Variation of Condition 2 (Materials) and 3 (Approved Plans) to allow alternative materials for windows and doors following planning permission 00248/380/P12 dated 23/07/2013 for conversion of existing first floor offices and the creation of a second floor extension, to form two no. two bedroom self contained flats, incorporating new entrance to existing shop.
